JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Elisabeth Steiner;Erik Møse;Khanlar Hajiyev;Linos-Alexandre Sicilianos;Peer Lorenzen
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . The present application was lodged by the applicant ’s guardian and daughter , PERSON , on behalf of her mother – the applicant . She was represented before the ORG by PERSON and Mr PERSON , lawyers practising in Ivanić Grad . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Ms Š. PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

By a decision of ORG ( PERSON ) of DATE the applicant was divested of her legal capacity on account of her mental illness . She did not participate in those proceedings but was represented by her father .

By a decision of ORG , ORG ( ORG za socijalnu skrb GPE , ORG – “ FAC ) of DATE the applicant ’s mother , PERSON , was appointed her legal guardian . On DATE the ORG appointed the applicant ’s brother PERSON her new legal guardian . The change was due to GPE ’s statement that their mother , PERSON , was no longer able to take care of the applicant ’s interests owing to her own illness .

On DATE the applicant ’s father died and inheritance proceedings were instituted before a public notary in GPE . The applicant did not participate in these proceedings in person , but was represented by her brother , PERSON The written record of a hearing held on DATE states that the present heirs , that is , the applicant ’s mother PERSON and her brother PERSON , agreed that PERSON would inherit all movables from her husband , while PERSON and the applicant would inherit a flat in GPE , FAC , so that GPE would become the owner of CARDINAL of the flat and the applicant of CARDINAL . On DATE a decision on inheritance was issued confirming that agreement .

On DATE the applicant ’s daughter , PERSON , submitted a request with the ORG , asking that she be appointed her mother ’s legal guardian . She explained that for DATE she had been studying in GPE and had now returned to GPE and was willing to care for her mother and fully capable of doing so . She added that all the family members supported her request .

On DATE PERSON informed the ORG that on DATE PERSON had thrown the applicant out of the flat where she had been living up to then ( the one left by her late father ) and changed the lock . PERSON asked the ORG to take urgent measures to protect the interests of the applicant . She reiterated this request again on CARDINAL DATE and on an unspecified date . She requested the ORG to bring a civil action against GPE for disturbance of possessions .

On DATE PERSON also lodged a request for supervision of the Centre ’s work with ORG ( ORG zdravstva i socijalne skrbi – the “ Ministry ” ) . She complained that her request of CARDINAL DATE to be appointed the applicant ’s legal guardian had not been registered or processed . A lawyer of the ORG had kept the request in a drawer and had only handed it back to PERSON on DATE at ORG ’s insistence ; PERSON had then had it recorded in the ORG ’s incoming mail register . She further alleged that PERSON had thrown the applicant out of the flat where she had been living , had moved into the flat himself and had been showing it to potential buyers . PERSON also maintained that the ORG had not protected the applicant ’s interests but on the contrary had already sent an expert to estimate the value of the flat .
On DATE the ORG employees visited the flat and found the applicant and CARDINAL there . The applicant said that she had no problems with her brother .
On DATE the Ministry asked the Centre to reply to PERSON ’s allegations .
On DATE the ORG asked GPE to reply to PERSON ’s allegations .

On DATE PERSON again urged the ORG to take measures to protect the applicant ’s interests . She alleged that the applicant had been released from a psychiatric hospital on DATE . Although PERSON had given the applicant the keys to the flat in DATE , he continued to take the keys away and give them back to her as he wished . He had also locked all but CARDINAL of the rooms of the flat , including those where items necessary for the applicant ’s DATE life were kept , such as her clothes , the washing machine and the switch that regulated the heating . Furthermore , he had prevented PERSON from living in the flat with the applicant , despite the applicant not being capable of taking care of herself because of her mental condition . Since PERSON no longer lived in the flat , the applicant lived alone . Thus , she had lived in the flat for DATE with no supervision , after which her condition had worsened and she had had to be hospitalised again .

ORG further maintained that GPE had been shouting at and threatening the applicant , which had caused her intense fear and worsened her condition . He had forbidden the applicant to visit their mother , PERSON , in an old people ’s home , threatening to beat her up if she did otherwise . PERSON continued that on DATE , on the applicant ’s birthday , PERSON had forbidden the applicant to invite her for lunch , and after that had again taken the keys to the flat from the applicant and had not returned them to her .
He had also been receiving the applicant ’s pension payments and spending them as he wished . PERSON asked as a matter of urgency that he be dismissed as the applicant ’s legal guardian .

On DATE a hearing was held in the FAC on the subject of changing the applicant ’s legal guardian . On DATE made a statement in the ORG that she objected to the sale of the flat where the applicant had lived unless PERSON provided another , smaller flat for the applicant .

On DATE the ORG appointed PERSON the applicant ’s legal guardian . On DATE the ORG appointed an attorney , GPE , the applicant ’s guardian ad litem in the proceedings concerning the sale of the flat in FAC . He was expressly authorised to take all actions in order to sell the flat .

At a hearing held on DATE in ORG said that the applicant had been discharged from a psychiatric hospital on DATE and that since then they had been living together in a rented flat , because PERSON had prevented them from living in the flat in FAC . She also stated that GPE was still receiving the applicant ’s pension payments and asked that they be paid to her and her mother .
An appeal lodged by PERSON against the decision of DATE concerning the authorisation given to GPE as regards the sale of the flat in FAC was dismissed on DATE by ORG .

At a hearing held on DATE in the Centre , PERSON was informed that in the meantime PERSON had returned a bank card for the bank account into which he had been receiving the applicant ’s pension payments . The card was handed over to PERSON However , PERSON had not handed over the applicant ’s pension for DATE and DATE .
At a hearing held in the ORG on DATE an offer made by GPE to buy the applicant ’s share of the flat in FAC was accepted by FAC .

By a decision of DATE the ORG authorised GPE to conclude a sale agreement with GPE and to deposit the sum of MONEY ( ORG ) in the applicant ’s bank account . On DATE PERSON lodged an appeal against that decision , arguing that a decision on inheritance had already been adopted unlawfully , since PERSON had represented the applicant in these proceedings although he was an interested party . She further argued that the price did not correspond to the market value of the applicant ’s share of the flat .
On DATE the ORG dismissed the appeal . On DATE G.B. lodged an administrative action with ORG ( Upravni sud PERSON ) against the ORG ’s decision .
At a hearing held on DATE in ORG was informed that PERSON had paid an amount of CARDINAL NORP kunas ( HRK ) into the applicant ’s bank account .
The proceedings concerning the sale of the flat are still pending before ORG .
The relevant provisions of LAW ( Obiteljski zakon , ORG nos . CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and DATE ) read :

“ ( CARDINAL ) An adult who , on account of mental illness or other reasons , is unable to care of his or her own needs , rights and interests , or who presents a risk to the rights and interests of others , shall be partially or completely divested of his or her legal capacity by a court of law in non - adversarial proceedings .
“ The competent social welfare centre shall place under guardianship a person ... divested of his or her legal capacity ... ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) The guardian shall care for the person , rights , obligations and well - being of the ward with due diligence , manage his or her assets and take measures aimed at enabling the ward to have an independent professional and personal life .
“ ( CARDINAL ) The guardian represents the ward .
“ In order to take more important measures concerning the person , personal status or health of the ward , the guardian shall obtain prior consent from a social welfare centre . ”
